required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 14, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Early Detection of Clinical Deterioration in Patients With COVID-19 Using Machine Learning
clinical_study.official_title: Early Detection of Clinical Deterioration in Patients With COVID-19 Using Machine Learning

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to use artificial intelligence in the form of machine learning analysing vital signs as well as symptoms of patients suffering from Covid19 to identify predictors of disease progression and severe course of disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Probability of Participants for Hospitalisation or Fatal Outcome
primary_outcome.time_frame: Detection of severe acute respiratory syndrome- Corona Virus 2 (SARS-CoV2) to recovery, hospitalisation or fatal outcome up to 5 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Probability of Participants for Intensive Care Unit Admission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Detection of SARS-CoV2 to recovery, hospitalisation or fatal outcome up to 5 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Probability of Participants for Fatal Outcome
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Detection of SARS-CoV2 to recovery, hospitalisation or fatal outcome up to 5 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Prediction of persisting health impairment by using standardized questionnaires
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Detection of SARS-CoV2 to recovery, hospitalisation or fatal outcome up to 5 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Detection of symptoms, vital parameters and comorbidities predicting clinical course
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Detection of SARS-CoV2 to recovery, hospitalisation or fatal outcome up to 5 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Influence of size of training data set
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Detection of SARS-CoV2 to recovery, hospitalisation or fatal outcome up to 5 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Influence of viral load on the course of disease/ clinical outcome
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Detection of SARS-CoV2 to recovery, hospitalisation or fatal outcome up to 5 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Influence of different virus variants on the course of disease/ clinical outcome
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Detection of SARS-CoV2 to recovery, hospitalisation or fatal outcome up to 5 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Influence of SARS-CoV2 vaccination (yes/no) on the course of disease/ clinical outcome
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Detection of SARS-CoV2 to recovery, hospitalisation or fatal outcome up to 5 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of parameters (symptoms, vital parameters, comorbidities) according to their potential of clinical course predictions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Detection of SARS-CoV2 to recovery, hospitalisation or fatal outcome up to 5 weeks
Detection of SARS-CoV2 to recovery, hospitalisation or fatal outcome up to 5 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Influence of different SARS-CoV2 vaccines on the course of disease/ clinical outcome
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Detection of SARS-CoV2 to recovery, hospitalisation or fatal outcome up to 5 weeks

arm_group.description: Randomly selection of 80% of the study population. The machine learning algorithm is trained on this dataset
Randomly selection of 20% of the study population. The machine learning algorithm which was trained on the basis of the training data cohort is validated on the validation cohort.

intervention.description: Machine learning on vital parameters, clinical symptoms and underlying diseases
Quantification of the prediction power and identification of the most relevant predictive parameters

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written informed consent
- Age >= 18 years
- Detection of SARS-CoV2 within the past 5 days
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to measure vital parameters and document symptoms

overall_official.affiliation: University Hospital of Tuebingen, Tuebingen, Germany
